signals.summary: MuleSoft reports that 50% of AI agents operate in silos, and 86% of IT leaders say agents add friction without proper integration, highlighting a growing complexity crisis.
World Liberty Financial unveils token plan tied to Trump Maldives Resort.
The government's own DSIT survey of 3,500 businesses, published January 2026, found only 1 in 6 UK businesses (16%) currently use AI—with 80% neither using nor planning to adopt.
Humain, a Saudi state-backed firm, secured up to $1.2 billion in financing to expand AI infrastructure and data center capacity.

Saudi Arabia is planning an investment partnership with Electronic Arts (EA), signaling a broader strategy of using M&A to embed global capabilities locally and accelerate domestic ecosystem development in areas such as digital media, gaming and advanced technology platforms.
Competenza accelerates compliant AI adoption by offering PDPL-proof architectures, in-region delivery, integration expertise, and a structured discovery-to-scale model tailored to GCC realities.
PepsiCo uses AI analytics on social media and consumption data to design new flavors and products in record time, shortening the product innovation cycle.
Alat, a Saudi Arabian global enterprise, is partnering with world’s leading innovators and universities to reimagine multiple industrial manufacturing processes using AI and advanced technology.
Inception, a UAE-based G42 company, is leveraging Kore.ai’s agentic platform to build intelligent assistants that streamline decision-making, governance, and operations across the enterprise.
IDC research commissioned by AWS and e& found that 74 percent of GCC organizations plan to adopt Agentic AI, yet only 19 percent have moved beyond pilots to full-scale deployment.

profile.objective: Identify 20-25 net-new buying signals for AI transformation and digital modernization.
inclusion_rules: Target institutions that are buyers/adopters, not vendors.
Prioritize strategic initiatives with implementation budget signals.
exclusion_rules: Exclude Tier-1 global banks, Big Tech, and top global consultancies.

categories.label: Action Strength
categories.description: How concrete the institutional action is.

categories.label: Buyer Fit
categories.description: How likely the institution is to buy consulting/services.

categories.label: Seniority
categories.description: Decision-maker level tied to the signal.
